Key Arguments: The proposed legislation violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill interferes with the ability to receive and impart information through social media.
The legislation represents a violation of Australians' human rights.
The government should not dictate what people can say or think.
There is a risk of abuse of power by unelected bureaucrats if the legislation is enacted.
Notable Quotes: Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights states that 'Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers.'
It is not the role of the government to tell people what they can and cannot say or think.
